Articles.Content:
Hi everyone. This is my first mod for Kerbal Space Program. It implements a tool for the Vehicle Assembly Building that allows you to precisely align parts. This is the v0.0.1 release so there are a number of limitations and cases in which it doesn't integrate with the stock systems as well as I'd like.

To activate the tool, use the button to the right of the reroot tool and select a surface attached part. Three axes will appear. Each axis has a draggable handle indicated by an opaque sphere in addition to several markers that are located at precise positions along the axis. Drag the handle to move the part along that axis.

Use the hotkeys to increase and decrease the symmetry mode (X, Shift+X) by default to change the number of markers on each axis.

When angle snap is enabled, the handle will "snap" to each marker so that you can precisely position parts at marked intervals along each axis.

Limitations

This is an alpha release of this mod. As a result, a number of features need to be implemented.

  • It doesn't work yet in the Spaceplane Hanger
  • The coordinate space button or hotkey doesn't do anything

[Update] This is now on CKAN under the name "AdjustmentTool"! Please file bug reports in GitHub.

Project URL and Source Code: https://github.com/ktchen14/AdjustmentTool

Download: https://github.com/ktchen14/AdjustmentTool/releases/download/v0.0.3/AdjustmentTool-v0.0.3.zip

congratulations on the release! looks like something I might use!
Release v0.0.2 is out! This version focuses on some internal polish, improves handling of compound parts (struts and fuel lines), and integrates into the undo/redo system.

I just pushed release v0.0.3. This fixes the calculation of the axes when a part is scaled so mods like ReStock should be (mostly) supported now. Also, there's a major new feature. New "reference" parts can be selected with Left Shift + Click. Check the README for more information!
